content.question: At a playground a student runs at a speed of <math alttext="5 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>5 m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and jump onto a circular disk of radius <math alttext="three halves meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> that is free to rotate around a fixed vertical axle. The student jumps on the disk several times, and the angular speed after the student lands is measured each time. Which of the following angular speeds is not a reasonable value for the measured angular speed?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.5 radian per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 radian per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 radians per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3 radians per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 radians per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 radians per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
